messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:48): http://blogs.msdn.com/ie/archive/2008/07/02/ie8-security-part-iv-the-xss-filter.aspx
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:50): (I guess that'll break my unlive DOM viewer...)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:53): http://blogs.msdn.com/ie/archive/2008/07/02/ie8-security-part-v-comprehensive-protection.aspx too - window.toStaticHTML(), native JSON, content-type sniffing changes, "Content-Type: text/plain; authoritative=true"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:55): and changes to <input type=file>.value
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:55): wtf is this xss filter
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:56): it just blocks anything that says "><script> ?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:56): you can probably ask the guy who posted that blog post during the break
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:56): he's in the room
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:57): next to shepazu
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:58): LOL
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:58): "authoritative=true"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:58): that's awesometastic
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:58): not exactly "out loud" :p

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:59): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: It sounds like it looks for suspicious strings in the request, and for similar strings in the response, and blocks them if the complex undocumented heuristics say it's probably XSS
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:00): Does HTML5 say a JS file served with Content-Type: text/javascript; authoritative=true must not be executed because it's got unknown type parameters?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:01): i believe so, yes
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:03): 3l of good juice for ¬£2.50. Not bad.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:04): And it did seem to have plenty of stuff, interestingly, despite both ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c and my mother's warnings
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:05): Well, it always has plenty of stuff, but often not of the few specific things I'm looking for :-(
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:17): has finished the client-side requirements for Web Sockets
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:17): Hmm, this wi-fi comes and goes
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:21): handy rule: anyone who writes "PhD" after their name is likely to be a jerk
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:22): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Knock on your neighbour's door and tell them off for having rubbish wireless
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:22): That means going across to the next block of flats, and that's too much effort
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:22): and it's my uncle's flat :P
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:23): Or go to http://192.168.0.1 (password "" or "admin") and see if you can reconfigure the wireless signal
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:24): Also, get irssi+screen+ssh so you don't miss the exciting happenings while you are disconnected :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:24): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: someday I will :P
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:25): I need a server that I can run irssi+screen on, before I can do that
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:25): Find an unencrypted wireless router and replace its firmware with Linux and use that as your server
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:26): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Can we actually put authorative=true in the HTML 5 spec? I mean, it won't break anything
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:26): hmm, that's an interesting idea
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:26): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, what is authorative=true?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:27): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: IE8b2 supports "Content-Type: text/plain; authoritative=true", which makes the Content-Type trusted
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:27): why don't they just stop implementing content sniffing?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:28): far too much relies upon it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:28): I do :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:28): It'd break as much as requiring an SGML parser to be used for text/html, almost
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:28): other browsers don't implment it as badly as IE does
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:29): They're making it better in IE8, though
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:29): sniffing binary files served as text/plain is ok, but IE goes too far by sniffing text/html
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:29): You need to sniff text/html for whether it is a feed, but no more
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:30): was IE8b2 released yet?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:30): Nope
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:30): ah, then where did you hear about authoritative=1 from?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:30): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: http://blogs.msdn.com/ie/
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:31): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: there's a load posted on the IE blog about what's coming
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:31): (See the latest three posts)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:31): The York Open Day managed to totally put me off CS there, FWIW
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:32): What did they do wrong?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:32): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, oh, I must have missed reading that last blog post
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:32): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: They care about the really high level, and the really low level, but not really anything between
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:33): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Like software engineering and digital electronics but no programming, or something like that?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:33): omg, X-Download-Options looks a bit silly
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:34): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Well, only programming is Java, and yeah, doing those two
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:35): I wonder about "authoritative=true"
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:35): I wonder if we'll later have "really-authoritative=true"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:36): Well, if other browsers don't do it, then we might end up like that :P
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:37): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: That won't be needed - just use "authoritative=truer"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:37): wonders what authoritative=false will do
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:37): authoritative=IE8
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:38): X-Sniffing-Algorithm: ie8
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:38): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427, would that mean that other browsers need to ask IE8 what it would do before proceeding?
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:38): so their toStaticHTML proposal might be worth something
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:39): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: yeah I think so. Maybe Microsoft should have a Web service that other browsers can hand content to for IE8 rendering
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:40): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427, nah, other browsers should just secretly embed IE8's rendering engine in their own products
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:40): then we'll have perfect interoperability
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:40): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Only if nobody ever upgrades to IE9
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:50): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: it's a retarded idea
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:50): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: FWIW York's open day totally put me off from going there but for different reasons
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:50): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: it'll just get content-sniffed itself in a few years
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:51): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: yeah i'm looking forward to being able to reverse engineer this and work out what they missed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:51): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: though i think sandboxed iframes might be a better solution in practice (with doc="" maybe)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:51): Maybe IIS will start sending authoritative=true by default on all content, for security
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:52): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: that would make it be sniffed even quicker
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:52): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: since IE7 will still sniff on those pages
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:52): yeah, sandboxes IFRAMEs would be considerably more powerful.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:52): Maybe IIS will UA-sniff and send authoritative=true to IE8
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:53): someone should lean on MS to put toStaticHTML through a standards group
